docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This project is a supporting package for tools which need to access the GitHub RESTful API. It includes a function to authenticate requests as a GitHub App installation, and a class which allows Get, Patch and Post request to be made easily.

This package is primarily used by:

  • GitHub Repository Archive Tool
  • GitHub CoPilot Usage Dashboard
  • GitHub Policy/Audit Dashboard

For more information, please see the README.md.

docs.title: GitHub API Package
docs.text: A Python package used to interact with the GitHub RESTful API.

docs.title: Installation
docs.text: This package can be installed using the GitHub repository URL.

docs.title: Usage
docs.text:
This package can be imported as a normal Python package.

Import whole module: 

import github_api_toolkit

Import part of the module: 

from github_api_toolkit import github_interface

docs.title: Development
docs.text:
This project uses pip for package management. Poetry was avoided to keep the package size small.

To develop/test the project locally, clone the repository then navigate to its root directory and run the following:

python3 -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

This will create a virtual environment, activate it and install all the project dependancies into it.

To deactivate the virtual environment, use: 

deactivate

docs.title: Documentation
docs.text:
This project uses MkDocs for documentation which gets deployed to GitHub Pages at a repository level.

For more information about MkDocs, see the below documentation.

Getting Started with MkDocs

docs.title: To update the GitHub Pages deployment:
docs.text:
1. Delete the old /mkdocs_deployment directory.

  2. Build the MkDocs Site.

mkdocs build

  1. Rename the /site directory to /mkdocs_deployment.

  2. Push changes to GitHub.

Once the changes are pushed, deploy_mkdocs.yml will be executed through GitHub Actions. This will deploy the /mkdocs_deployment to GitHub Pages.
